page.title: 06Astonbury Woods
page.content: These are ancient woods. It covers 56 acres. The trees are mainly deciduous. The House was originally owned by Sir Philip Boteler and was built between 1540-1545. Before the House there was a monastery on the site which was built before 1088. Herts County Council purchased the land in 1972. The nature reserve was started in 1974. Mrs. Daphne Coates has been the warden since 1975 when the studies centre was built. The centre is used by schools from North Herts and Stevenage. Because it is a large wood there are a lot of birds and animals in it e.g. badger, fox, rabbit, deer, squirrels and many different birds. The Herts and Middlesex Trust for Nature Conservation help to look after the wood and plan its future development to maintain healthy trees and plenty of wild flowers.
